intro: Coffea uniflora, commonly known as the single-flower coffee plant, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the highlands of Ethiopia and is characterized by its small, white flowers and oval-shaped leaves. The plant produces red berries that contain the seeds used for coffee production. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of about 1–2 meters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Coffea uniflora is considered a rare and endangered species.
